name: 高級寫作（一）
restrict: ◎必須先修過【ENU0287  中級寫作（一）】、【ENU0288  中級寫作（二）】
description: In Advanced Writing, the course aims to integrate writing skills students learned in previous two years with their knowledge of a topic, subject, or theme in order to prepare students for future career. Creative use of different types of essays will be expected to be contextualized in different fields, including exam-related, work-related, or research paper related fields. Language-based writing can also be integrated with different modes of communication, such as pictures, audios, webpages as an individual or group project.
goals: To help students rehearse skills in various modes of writing
Help students build a good sense of the difference between smart, sophisticated, quality writing and bland, hackneyed writing
Students are expected to integrate writing techniques with their knowledge of the topic/subject
syllabus:
**Course description**

The first half of this year-long course focuses on practical writing. In particular, students will study and write various types of business letters (e.g., cover letter, reservation letter, sponsorship letter, welcome letter, advice letter, as well as personal statement for graduate school. Through writing tasks and occasional review of usage and convention, the course provides the repeated practice students need in honing business writing skills.

**Required text**

Handouts and samples provided by the instructor.

**Course requirements**

Writing assignments (55%)

\--Include resume, cover letter, reservation letter, sponsorship letter, welcome letter, advice letter, and GS personal statement.

Two quizzes (10% each)

\--Covering usage and convention tips as reviewed in class

Attendance & Participation (25%)

\--Include in-class activities, editing exercises, and consultations
